museums.name: Palace of Versailles
museums.description: Versailles was the home of the French monarch from the time of Louis XIV to Louis XVI. The palace stands today as an icon of nobility and artistic triumph.
museums.speech: Versailles was the home of the French monarch from the time of Louis the 14th to Louis the 16th. The palace stands today as an icon of nobility and artistic triumph.

museums.name: Royal Palaces Amsterdam
museums.description: The Royal Palace in Amsterdam was built as city hall during the Dutch Golden Age in the seventeenth century. The building became the royal palace of king Louis Napoleon and later of the Dutch Royal House.
museums.speech: The Royal Palace in Amsterdam was built as city hall during the Dutch Golden Age in the seventeenth century. The building became the royal palace of king Louis Napoleon and later of the Dutch Royal House.

museums.name: American Art Museum, Smithsonian
museums.description: Located in Washington D.C., The Smithsonian American Art Museum is the nation's first collection of American art. The museum has been a leader in identifying and collecting significant aspects of American visual culture.
museums.speech: Located in Washington DC, The Smithsonian American Art Museum is the nation's first collection of American art. The museum has been a leader in identifying and collecting significant aspects of American visual culture.

museums.name: The Frick Collection
museums.city: New York, New York, United States
museums.description: Opened on December 16, 1935, The Frick is one of most distinguished small art museums in the world. The Frick Collection includes some of the best-known paintings by the European masters, major works of sculpture (among them one of the finest groups of small bronzes in the world), superb eighteenth-century French furniture and porcelains, Limoges enamels, Oriental rugs, and other works of remarkable quality.
museums.speech: Opened on December 16, 1935, The Frick is one of most distinguished small art museums in the world. The Frick Collection includes some of the best-known paintings by the European masters, major works of sculpture, among them one of the finest groups of small bronzes in the world, superb eighteenth-century French furniture and porcelains, Limoges enamels, Oriental rugs, and other works of remarkable quality.

museums.name: Castle de Fontainebleau
museums.description:
Fontainebleau was a royal country house for more than eight centuries. The art, architecture and gardens are a monument of French history.
With over 1500 rooms at the heart of 130 acres of parkland and gardens, Fontainebleau is the only royal and imperial château to have been continuously inhabited for seven centuries.
museums.speech:
Fontainebleau was a royal country house for more than eight centuries. The art, architecture and gardens are a monument of French history.
With over 1500 rooms at the heart of 130 acres of parkland and gardens, Fontainebleau is the only royal and imperial château to have been continuously inhabited for seven centuries.

museums.name: Kunsthistorisches Museum (KHM)
museums.description: The Kunsthistorisches Museum ("Museum of Art History") in Vienna is one of the foremost museums in the world, with rich holdings comprising artworks from seven millennia - from Ancient Egypt to the late 18th century. The collections of Renaissance and Baroque art are of particular importance.
museums.speech: The "Museum of Art History" in Vienna is one of the foremost museums in the world, with rich holdings comprising artworks from seven millennia - from Ancient Egypt to the late 18th century. The collections of Renaissance and Baroque art are of particular importance.

museums.name: Musei Capitolini
museums.description: The Musei Capitolini are a group of art and archeological museums in Piazza del Campidoglio, on top of the Capitoline Hill in Rome, Italy. The museum is the oldest public collection of art in the world, dating back to 1471 when Pope Sixtus IV donated a group of important ancient sculptures to the people of Rome.
museums.speech: The Musei Capitolini are a group of art and archeological museums in Piazza del Campidoglio, on top of the Capitoline Hill in Rome Italy. The museum is the oldest public collection of art in the world, dating back to 14 71 when Pope Sixtus the 4th donated a group of important ancient sculptures to the people of Rome.

museums.name: Alte Nationalgalerie
museums.description: Established in Berlin in 1861, the Old National Gallery (Alte Nationalgalerie) is home to 19th century sculptures and paintings. The museum shows a collection of Classicism and Romanticism, Biedermeier and French Impressionism.
museums.speech: Established in Berlin in 1861, the Old National Gallery is home to 19th century sculptures and paintings. The museum shows a collection of Classicism and Romanticism, Biedermeier and French Impressionism.
